Name: Priyanshu
College: Gurukula Kangri Vishwavidyalaya Faculty of Engineering & Technology
Heading: college Review.
Review: I have chosen this course because I have had a passion to do engineering since my birth. As I do not get good marks in jee mains so for me there is not an any better option. That's why I have chosen this college. Students to faculty ratio are approx. 40 - 45.  As in the electrical department, there are 7 faculties and students are approx 300. Generally, teachers have pursued M-tech. But some are Ph.D. holders as well. some young teachers are good. Otherwise, you have to study on your own for the exam. Because you will not able to understands all things in the class.  Sometimes semester exams are taken in February. But this time it is on time. It is easy to pass semesters after studying 15 days before the semester.

Name: Riya
Heading: Knowing Gargi, beyond Review
Review:
Through I had an interest in my selected course, I had Political Science at the top of my priority list. However, I did not clear the cutoffs for that.
 I had an acquaintance who was herself a student of Gargi College so I took her reviews on the college and finally took admission.
The faculty especially of history here is considered to be one of the best, therefore I chose this course. And I don't regret it a bit. The faculty members are qualified and pursue different teaching methods for a great classroom environment( conduct trips to supplement class learning). The timings for exams( for all the colleges in DU) were hampered for three semester and they were scheduled earlier as OBE by keeping the pandemic in mind. The OBE exams used to be quite hectic as we were not used to those and it did not give that exam hall environment too. It had been only 2 seems since we appeared for offline exams. For me, they were not difficult to pass. The questions to are usually based on the PYQs only.

Name: Govindu Sai Vaishnavi
College: Sam Higginbottom University of Agriculture Technology and Sciences - [SHUATS]
Heading: THE BEST IS YET TO COME
Review: There are many annual fests are conducted such as youth vibe, one India, one world, coke studio, spectra, and many others. Sports have more crucial importance in our college. There is a division of the student affair club where we can participate in all types of activities.

Name: Devika
Heading: Experience of Faculty of law
Review:
There is no annual fest of the Faculty of law, although farewell, freshers, some festivals, and society fest are conducted once a year.
All the books are available in the campus library as well as in the central library of DU.
There are few sports activities in the Faculty of the law of Du as they majority focus on improving intellect.
There are various groups that are run by students like - Abvp, Nsui, and Aisa.

Name: Vijay
Heading: Nice college
Review: I choose CSE because I am very much interested in computer technology so I took CSE for my career. Computer Science is the top branch in the entire BTECH. It is computer-based on the working in future also. our college faculty also is very good staff and well-experienced faculty in the campus qualification is based on the student's intermediate or SSC-based marks on the seat allotment Exams are conducted in a calendar-wise model. it is strictly invigilating the faculty and also very tough to copy the exams. it is based on our knowledge to write exams.  I have an interest in programming and coding so I had chosen this course faculty is so friendly with students but strict in studies. The student ratio in this college is more than 18000 students in KL University Guntur Faculties had completed their graduation and some are completed their master's studies The teaching method is very good and students also have an interest to study Term exams.

Name: Sheik Abdulla
Heading: Honest Review
Review:
Our College Infrastructure is so beautiful that if you visit our College you will definitely fall in love with its infrastructure and will end up getting admission to it.
Our College does conduct fests. there are 2 or 3 fests. Colosseum is one of them.
The library is great. We can find all types of books even if we can't find the book that we wanted. we just have to inform the librarian and they will bring that for us.

Lack of sports activities.

Heading: VCET review

Name: SuryaNarayana K
College: Ramaiah College of Arts, Science and Commerce - [RCASC]
Heading: Read This If You Wants To Join For MBA In MSRCASC

There was equal importance for sports & other extra curriculum activities.

Name: ROHIT HARAKCHAND KARNAWAT
Heading: Everything has a scope for betterment
Review:

The ratio of faculty to students is around 60 students per faculty for the lecture and 20 students per faculty for the lab.
Faculty are well qualified mostly all are Ph.D.
Visiting faculties are up to MTech qualifications.
Exams are conceptual-based based but repetitive question format as compared to last year.

Name: Deepjyoti Dutta
College: Girijananda Chowdhury Institute of Management & Technology - [GIMT]
Heading: A detailed review of Girijananda Chowdhury Institute of Management and Technology
Review:
The annual fest is Euphisim which is celebrated after a gap of 1 year in the month of February.
The tech fest is Techmilap which is a 3day technical fest which is celebrated every year on the month of May.
Various books and journals are available in the college library. One can issue the books for a period of 14 days.
All the basic necessities are available in the classroom which also includes smart boards , projection screens, etc.
Sports week is celebrated every year on the months of months of December.
There are various social groups available at Instagram run by the students.

Name: Akash Mandal
Heading: BENGALI DEPARTMENT IN WBSU
Review:
We have a small celebration of fresher's welcome in our department. I have witnessed Holi Utsav in our college. It was organized by the student union. In our Bengali department, we also organized some cultural functions on 21 Feb as it is our mother language day. We celebrated Rabindra Jayanti and Netaji Jayanti. Saraswati Puja is also organized in rich attire. Our library room is one of the best. It is so well organized and colorful. All the books are kept in a row of colorful bookshelves. and there is so much wide space for studying. In a corner, there have multiple computers to complete the project.
Our classroom is very good. The room has big windows and glasses. It is very airy and clean. All the benches and tables everything is new. We have a very big ground where students play football and cricket. On our campus, we play badminton. annual sports programs are organized each year. We have a Wi-Fi facility and a greener campus.

Name: Shaik sohail
Heading: The best college to complete my graduation in low cost.
Review: According to me, the national college is for middle-class people because they cost very low to graduate per year BCA, it is only 18500 and the other courses are very low compared to BCA. We can get a scholarship as Vidhyadeevena and fees reimbursement.

Name: Lipika Arya
Heading: MSIT review by 2nd year student (batch 2021-25)
Review:

There are various societies such as- 
PRAKRITI- the environmental and humanitarian society. It is the most active society on campus. It also hosts the annual cultural fest of MSIT i.e ENVA.

It has various affinity groups such as IEEE WIE (women in engineering), IEEE RAS (robotics and automation society), and IEEE CS (computer science).  TARK- it is the debating, writing, and poetic society.
 CEREBRATE- a debating society, is very active and participates in various intercollege events. 
 ASTITVA and UNITY STREETS- these are the dance societies. 
Aarambh and SIFAR- the dramatics society.
E-cell- the entrepreneurship society, has also been very active throughout the years and holds various pitching events in collaboration with HULT PRIZE MSIT.

College: J.C. Bose University Of Science And Technology, YMCA
Heading: TURELY HELPING HANDS

Books are easily available in the library .1st year students can use library books for the whole semester. After 15 days policy starts. library books ar provided for only 15 days. After that, it is compulsory to reissue it.

Name: Charmitha Garugu
Heading: If you want placement for sure in life get the seat in klu
Review:
The CSE course is Trending and I find fun always doing it. All faculty is good and amazing and the faculty and students ratio is 2: 70 per class.
Faculty will be helpful always and give important lectures which are helpful to students.
Once you learn the teacher's notes you will pass the exam.

Name: Pragati gangwar
College: Indira Gandhi Delhi Technical University For Women -[IGDTUW]
Heading: Review of IGDTUW
Review:
I'm pursuing BTech in the IT branch of this college because have an interest in this. Currently, I'm in my first year. I think igdtuw is comparable to dtu and nsut in terms of placements and internship opportunities. There are almost 150 students in each branch.
The curriculum is updated and teachers are also knowledgeable. Some faculties are not good but I guess that is bearable.
In every year there is a total of 2 semesters and in each semester there are a total of two exams midsem and endsem level of exam is also moderate, you can earn really good marks even after studying 1 week before the exam.

Name: SATYAM KUMAR
College: Sant Longowal Institute of Engineering and Technology - [SLIET]
Heading: Good initiative
Review:
Life on the campus is good because this university is eco-friendly in terms of the environment and many more. The university is nature friendly and they care about nature like planting trees. Different types of birds migrated to the university because of the greenery environment and many ponds here.
University has conducted two annual fests TECHFEST-it belongs to the technical things students have presented their projects like robotics, camphor, drone, ship wars, etc. and the second is  MADHURAM -Which is a cultural fest where students perform dances, singing, modeling, etc.
Many clubs are also here for the students to learn like Happy club, Endeavor club, Indian society for technical, Paddlers, NSS, and many more.
The Big central library is here where huge amounts of books are there, the digital library is also and also the Study center all the facilities are available free of cost for the students.
All types of sports and extracurricular activities are here.

Name: Abhishek Pratap Singh
Heading: A happy life
Review: I chose the computer science and engineering branch in biet jhansi, and the faculty members are very supportive. They are always there for our help. The teaching method is good, they are very qualified, and there are two ct and one-semester exams to be done.

Name: Argha Guha
Heading: Jadavpur University
Review: There is a separate library for every department and a central library is there as well which provides a plethora of books, ebooks, and journals. The sports facilities are quite good on the main campus which includes Table Tennis, Football, Basketball, Badminton, etc and the Salt lake campus has professional cricket facilities. There are many clubs like the Science Club, Photography Club, Mountaineering and Hiking Club, etc which are active and organised as well as participate in many events. The classrooms have all the basic facilities required. But the overall infrastructure can be improved. The tech fest is called Srijan which takes place in March every year and the annual fest is Sanskriti.

Name: Suyash Baranwal
Heading: Unbiased review of lnct group of colleges
Review:
It basically depends upon which branch you pick. Students in 1 St year have the same subject. faculty: student ratio is 1:50.
The faculty is ok but some are great. Some faculty is Ph.D. holders and some are M.tech degrees. In one semester, there is 1 term exam and 2 mid-term exams. The difficulty of exams is less and any one can score good marks with less hard work. The previous year's question is very important. The faculty is not much supportive.

Name: Om Prajapati
Heading: Opportunities for Internship
Review:
The college gives us the opportunity of an internship.
In the internship, first, you have to complete the 100-200 hours of course about HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
After completing the course, The college finds a company for us and we have to select the company and do what the company wants.

Name: SATYAM KUMAR
Heading: Internship at DTU
Review:
Companies start arriving for hiring interns in the last week of July and all major companies complete their process by August (except Adobe which comes in January).
All major companies like Amazon, Samsung, D.E.Shaw, Arcesium, Microsoft, Directi, and Expedia
come in August. Every company has a similar process although the topic of questions asked and the number of rounds
may vary.
General Procedure:
1. Online Coding Round: Consisting of Multiple Choice Questions based on Aptitude, DS, Algo, OS and DBMS and 2 or 3 coding questions.
2. 2-3 Technical Interviews which test your skills in DS, Algorithm and coding.
3. HR round

Heading: Pgims rohtak reality check
Review: I chose the course because I did not get selected for M.B.B.S. Initially I was not happy with this course but with time i found my happiness in the course. Name: KUNTAL GORAI
Heading: STRESSFUL COLLEGE WITH A LOT OF EXCITMENT.
Review:
Life on campus is good. There are various circular activities like hackathons, quiz maina etc. It will be more fun if you are at our campus (they have lot more events than ec campus). We have an annual fest held during the month of October-November.
There are a sufficient number of books at the library for reference and you get access to the digital library (containing books, research papers, and previous years' qps for every course) if you are a PES university student.
Every classroom had a large tv to project slides presented by the professor and large blackboards. It has also sufficient benches (three students per bench can suffice the entire strength of the classroom). It has many cupboards for you to keep some extra accessories (not your college bags).
There are a lot of sports activities going on every semester like table tennis, cricket(a large cricket ground), football, volleyball, badminton court etc.
There are a lot of social groups run by students you can check the pes university link for more details.

Name: Wali haider
Heading: My opinion
Review: The admission process is quite complicated but not lengthy. There are three types of modes of admission in this college. The first one is through JEE mains score cutoff which is around 89 percentile or around 80000 ranks for Computer Science and Engineering Branch. The second one is through management quota but the admission fee is a bit more as compared to the previous one. The last mode is through the merit-based selection which is based on class 12th percentage or marks. You can find the application form of this college on their official website or through AKTU counseling. The application fee is 1000 approximately. The date of the application form is released after Jee Main's result.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: CODE MFGC
Review:
The campus is not that liking but it's nice how it is.
In the center of the college, there is an assembly ground known as Quadrangle its so nice and beautiful there we assemble weekly assembly on SAT and give rewards to those who made achievements like in sports, study, NCC, etc.
The library is the best thing in this college there is every book on your syllabus and some reading books, you could take any books you like by making a library card and you have to return them in the period they are given.
Sports there is every sport which you wanna join you can join and practice (ex. Chess, TT, cricket, etc)
Also, there is NCC.
There is a volunteer group known as VOMC which is for maintaining any crowd situations, also they have been volunteers for other colleges too.

Name: Vikanshi
Heading: Internship

Groups like Google and geeks for geeks student chapters are also present here and work actively. So in short if you are really interested in something LPU will help you in achieving it with its own benefits obviously but if are here to just enjoy college life and without any future aim then LPU will motivate you to enjoy the campus life ;)

Name: Pinninti Kiran sai
College: Aditya Institute of Technology and Management -[AITAM] Tekkali
Heading: College review : sweet and sour
Review: The fee structure is quite good when compared to other colleges. We have to pay a total of 80000 for the two semesters with an additional amount of 10000 to be paid as a building fund. We have to pay 40000 in the first semester and another 40000 in another semester. And during semester exams we need to pay 1600 as term exam fees. Review: I chose this course because it was recommended to me by the school's principal and then when I look into the curriculum of the course I got really impressed because they have a very diverse and innovative curriculum. The library is well-equipped with Wi-Fi facilities all over the campus. Labs are well-built and fully equipped. Mess food is far better than most NITs. Medical insurance is provided for college students. Dhyan hand stadium is there.

The best thing in iitr is college life there are several groups.
You name it we have it.
There are groups for music, dance, coding,  data science, poetry, quizzing, robotics, mobile dev, app dev, eSports, fine arts, filmmaking, design, dramatics, photography, campus news, magazine, cinema, finance, eco, racing, ecell.
And many more I can't even remember all of.
For sports, there are grounds for each sport like volleyball, cricket, football, squash, gym, hockey, badminton, aquatics, snooker, and table tennis.
IIT Roorkee has Olympic size swimming pool.
All the clubs are run by students.
HEC Himalayan explorer club is quite famous in our college because of its trek trips.
Our library is a beautiful two-floor building that has availability of all kinds of academic and non-academic books.
Students can issue a book free of cost for 15 days.
Thomson is the annual cultural fest (oct)and cognizance(March-April) is the tech fest.

Students are allowed out of campus at Any time.

Name: Akash Debbarma
Heading: Very Good College with good infrastructure facilities

At admission time our college charged 30000 for the English Honours subject. The admission fees are different for every other course: 280000 to 35000.
The semester fee is 11000 and the per month fee is 2100 and our college provides bus for students, and bus fees is 1200 per month.
Our college is not providing any Scholarships like other Government college's , but every ST & SC students can apply for scholarship through government portal or website : ugc.nic.in , this scholarship is provided by University Grant Commission.

Name: Rishab Mudliar
Heading: Insider's review of Amrita School of Engineering
Review:
Campus Life is not the best aspect of this college as it is a strict place but still, we do have technical fests like Vidyut every year so that will be a lot of fun. 
The libraries are good enough and you can find most books you want for your curriculum and of course, there are novels or magazines as well you could read in your free time. The classrooms are basic but not bad.
Sports and extra-curricular activities are less here as the focus is more on the coursework so it won't be a good place for people interested in playing sports for college.
Finally, we have a good amount of clubs technical and non-technical. We have two technical clubs amFOSS(open-source) and bi0s(ethical hacking) and the members of these clubs have won hackathons, and CTFs and have also been selected for prestigious programs like Google Summer of Code and have been placed at companies like Amazon, Google, Microsoft.
At the same time, there are more clubs coming up related to AI, Competitive Programming, Yoga, etc.

Review:

Almost all of the students(both from on-campus and off-campus) get placed in college. Many students even apply for higher studies. The college has the strongest Alumni network with many cities having their own Alumni chapters(in fact the strongest in all of Odisha).

Name: AYUSH PRADHAN
Heading: Everything About Nit Rourkela In A Brief
Review:
There are a total of 4 fests conducted every year. One is Innovision which is the largest techno-management fest of eastern India, one is Cosmopolitan which is the films and music fest, one is Vriddhi the sports fest and one is Nitrutsav the literary and cultural fest. The fest started in the month of August with a one or one-half-month gap between the next fest.
Each classroom is a smart classroom with a lot of benches and desks in which two people sit. All classrooms are equipped with air conditioners and fans.
The club culture of Nit Rourkela is very large. There are different types of clubs for different activities like drama clubs, dance clubs, art clubs, music clubs etc.
The Institute Counselling Service(ICS) is a student body which is run by students to solve student-related issues.

Name: Arbaz Ansari
Heading: That is the full review of My College
Review:
Names of Annual Fest are Freshers Party, Utkarsh, Udaan, Agaaz, Placements Day Celebration, Republic Day, Independence Day, and many more.
Tech fests like Inforia are done every 1-2 months there are many options that you can participate in one.
Almost every book is available. You can take any book which you want If you paid the library fees.
Amenities in classrooms:-  There are different types of Classrooms for every subject like - Digital projector classrooms, Projector Seminars, Computer Labs, Physics Labs, Chemistry Labs, BE/BEE Labs, and workshops ( Mechanical &Civil).
On our College Campus different types of playgrounds for different games:- 
1. Cricket Ground
2. Football Ground 
3. Basketball Ball ground
4. Volly Ball Ground
You can also play with other college students as a team of IESians.
I and my classmates make a social group and discuss problem-solving and business Ideas. Yes, our seniors make clubs or websites for students.

Although the faculty is highly qualified the teaching methods need to be updated. Some of the new teachers have started adopting new and innovative methods but the previously existing professors need to adapt too.
Due to the global pandemic, our entire curriculum was disrupted. This led to the conduction of 3-semester finals within a single year. Although this can't be blamed upon the college as it is controlled by Gauhati University (which affiliates with our college).
Lastly, speaking of the exam difficulty, you can cover the theoretical part in about 1 month for all the subjects.
